intro: Hyoscyamus pictus, commonly known as the painted bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a herbaceous perennial that produces striking, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue, violet, and white. The plant has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice among gardeners.
